newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gold mulls $350, will cue off platinum.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gold mulls $350, will cue off platinum.

text.p: SPOT NY CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Precious metal markets are poised to push higher on Wednesday, with the move likely to be led by the platinum group metals (PGMs), analysts said.
Gold is near $350, but will meet stern resistance there, unless there is momentum generated by the PGMs which remain in tight supply, they said.
PLATINUM -
Both platinum and palladium continue to be underpinned by tight supply and uncertainty over when Russian availability will improve.
"It is very difficult to judge all these comments from Russia and Japan," a European analyst said.
Russia's PGM export agency said on Tuesday that it has started talks with clients on 1997 deliveries, and that exports to Japan should start in June.
In the short-term, physical market conditions remain the same.
"As long as there no deliveries, end-users will have to buy off the spot market," the analyst said.
Platinum is currently holding above $390, and could push up to test the week's highs near $399.
At 0827 GMT platinum was quoted at an unchanged $392.50/393.50.
GOLD -
Bullion prices have settled in a new range which broadly runs between $346 and $350, but the upper level will prove to be strong resistance.
"It is fully dependent on what happens in the platinum market...and I think it will be difficult to break that psychological resistance at $350," the analyst said.
"Though the technical picture is bullish, it is possible that gold will experience a respite before further advances," analyst Martin Squires at Rudolf Wolff and Co said.
At 0827 GMT gold was indicated at $349.00/349.40, down around $0.15.
SILVER -
Prices have been helped by the general firmness of the precious metals complex, but the market is now encountering an area of resistance that swirls around $4.90.
At 0827 GMT silver was at $4.86/4.88, down two cents from Tuesday.
--Martin Hayes, London Newsroom 44 171 542 8080
